CivilianWaiting.synopsis: Dialog with Civilian outside Figaro's. She is a civilian waiting outside wanting to buy clothes.
CivilianWaiting.how_to_trigger: Click on S_LOW_Figaros_CivilianWaiting_a302cea3-9950-48cb-828d-b8b35e397975. But the character will no be there if Dolor is inside the store.

Naaber.synopsis: Naaber's dialog at Carmen's Cosmetics Shop in Wyrm's Crossing. He's very annoying and going through his entire dialog will give you an experience reward.
Naaber.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Go to Carmen's cosmetics shop ( S_WYR_FigaroSister_DEBUG_Point_5d7b1276-f516-49f2-b3ea-3564b25cd35c ) and talk to Naaber S_LOW_Figaros_Naaber_fa22f4a3-53ba-4a35-9dec-a402244a5203

Naaber_AD.synopsis: Repeated AD for Naaber when he is following you at Carmen's cosmetics shop or the Chiontar riverside in Wyrm's Crossing.
Naaber_AD.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/BGO_Main_A- Go to Carmen's cosmetics shop ( S_WYR_FigaroSister_DEBUG_Point_5d7b1276-f516-49f2-b3ea-3564b25cd35c ) and get spotted by Naaber S_LOW_Figaros_Naaber_fa22f4a3-53ba-4a35-9dec-a402244a5203

CivilianWaiting_0.speaker: Kale Dorriacks
CivilianWaiting_0.text: Might be my last chance to find anything new, the way things are looking. Things in the city have become so... unpredictable.

CivilianWaiting_1.speaker: Kale Dorriacks
CivilianWaiting_1.text: You might be waiting a while. I've been standing around for an age.

CivilianWaiting_2.speaker: Kale Dorriacks
CivilianWaiting_2.text: Heavens, what's the hold-up? I daresay the wait is shorter in the City of Judgement.

CivilianWaiting_3.speaker: Kale Dorriacks
CivilianWaiting_3.text: Oh, don't mind me. Notorious dawdler. I never can make up my mind about what to get.

Naaber_54.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_54.text: Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy biiiiiiirthday dear...

Naaber_53.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_53.text: What do you think? Am I a good bard?

Naaber_230.speaker: Player
Naaber_230.text: All the bards I've met play an instrument.

Naaber_225.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_225.text: Oh. I don't have one of those. Balls. Back to the Naabing board, then...

Naaber_24.speaker: Player
Naaber_24.text: You were great! Keep at it!

Naaber_179.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_179.text: You're humouring me again, aren't you? Oh well... back to the Naabing board.

Naaber_37.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_37.text: Oh... sorry - shit. I didn't know bards had to bake too...

Naaber_224.speaker: Player
Naaber_224.text: I'd cut out your tongue, but I want to know you've inflicted this misery on the rest of the city.

Naaber_30.speaker: Player
Naaber_30.text: What is it this time? Bard?

Naaber_99.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_99.text: Yep! That's right! Help me out here. Happy biiiiiirthday deeeeear...

Naaber_180.speaker: Player
Naaber_180.text: I was sculpted from a slice of Bhaal's own dead flesh. I have no birthday.

Naaber_61.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_61.text: It isn't? Shoot. What did you think, anyway?

Naaber_91.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_91.text: Could I be a good bard?

Naaber_143.speaker: Player
Naaber_143.text: Sing your name in a long, high, operatic tone.

Naaber_153.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_153.text: Wooooooow. That was so much better than I'll ever be.

Naaber_152.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_152.text: Oof. Is that what good sounds like? Gross.

Naaber_90.speaker: Player
Naaber_90.text: Shut up shut up shut up.

Naaber_64.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_64.text: Haha! Why would I do that?

Naaber_181.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_181.text: Come on - play along now. Haaaaaappy biiiiiirthday deeeear...

Naaber_71.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_71.text: Perhaps the answer was deep within me all along... an ancient spark of arcana... Yes, I was born to be a sorcerer, I can feel it.

Naaber_199.speaker: Player
Naaber_199.text: Cool, can you do any magic?

Naaber_11.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_11.text: Let me focus... I can feel the power deep within me... it's coming up! It's coming up!

Naaber_62.speaker: Player
Naaber_62.text: Does your magic also come from the beating heart of the storm?

Naaber_264.speaker: Player
Naaber_264.text: Bhaal said I would go mad... is it happening already? Is this idiot my tormenter?

Naaber_253.speaker: Player
Naaber_253.text: Why do I keep talking to this idiot? Why? Why?

Naaber_148.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_148.text: Oh - you meant me. Haha, good one!

Naaber_256.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_256.text: Am I boring you? I feel like I'm boring you.

Naaber_89.speaker: Player
Naaber_89.text: I take it you've decided to try being a monk?

Naaber_87.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_87.text: I'm going to be the best monk there ever was!

Naaber_198.speaker: Player
Naaber_198.text: Go back to being silent, then.

Naaber_97.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_97.text: What are you talking about? I can shut up whenever I want!

Naaber_38.speaker: Narrator
Naaber_38.text: *Naaber seals his lips, but you feel the pressure of words behind them. The poor thing is straining fit to burst.*

Naaber_98.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_98.text: Aaaaaaargh! Ican'tdoitIhavetoomuchtosay! You were right. I can't be a monk. I just want to TALK. Talking's great, see? You can say words, make friends, tell everyone everything you're thinking and feeling...

Naaber_16.speaker: Narrator
Naaber_16.text: *As he empties himself of his latest slew of thoughts, you take the opportunity to slip away.*

Naaber_114.speaker: Player
Naaber_114.text: I doubt you'll find peace, but the rest of us might. If we're lucky.

Naaber_167.speaker: Player
Naaber_167.text: Are we still not done yet?

Naaber_41.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_41.text: Oh HI! I didn't see you there! I was in deep meditation, see.

Naaber_83.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_83.text: Isn't peace and quiet just the best?

Naaber_45.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_45.text: I've decided to be a monk!

Naaber_122.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_122.text: My liege. I swear to you an undying oath of absolute devotion. I am but your humble paladin.
Naaber_122.context: CinematicNodeContext: Use HUM_M_Rig_DFLT_CINE_Bows_Kneel_01 to show Naaber kneeling.

Naaber_70.speaker: Player
Naaber_70.text: My only command is that you never speak to me again.

Naaber_169.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_169.text: I'M SORRY I CAN'T DO IT I'M JUST TOO EXCITED TO TALK TO YOU.

Naaber_127.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_127.text: Oh. Oh. Oh no... Something inside me feels very wrong...

Naaber_57.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_57.text: Did I just break something? I hope it wasn't anything important. Ha... ha...
Naaber_57.context: NodeContext: nervous laughter at the end

Naaber_27.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_27.text: Really? But... I'm ready to do anything.

Naaber_93.speaker: Player
Naaber_93.text: Then you must follow my commands. My first is this - break your oath. Now.

Naaber_187.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_187.text: But I - How am I supposed to -

Naaber_123.speaker: Player
Naaber_123.text: I am afraid I am sworn to an oath of my own. I cannot be your master.

Naaber_144.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_144.text: Oh well. BACK TO THE NAABING BOARD.

Naaber_207.speaker: Player
Naaber_207.text: I have done many terrible things, but I regret none more than listening to you.

Naaber_9.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_9.text: But... you're the one who keeps talking to me.

Naaber_111.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_111.text: I - I don't want to - all right. An oath's an oath, I suppose...

Naaber_105.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_105.text: I can swear a different oath if you like? Come baaaaaack!

Naaber_129.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_129.text: Bless us with your gentle - no, holy - spirit - no, soul - no, spirit... your powers - your divine powers... bother.

Naaber_108.speaker: Player
Naaber_108.text: What happened to being a bard? I thought you were enjoying that?

Naaber_3.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_3.text: Felt a bit lowbrow for Naaber. What's a bard going to do, sing at you? Hah!

Naaber_166.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_166.text: No, I've decided I'm going to be a cleric. Now if you'll excuse me, I must pray.

Naaber_232.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_232.text: Our holy - um - most holy - sacrilege - heretic? GOD. Bless us. Please?

Naaber_2.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_2.text: Wait, no! Come back! I haven't blessed you yet!

Naaber_161.speaker: Player
Naaber_161.text: Whatever you're doing, I'm pretty sure you're doing it wrong.

Naaber_88.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_88.text: I'm praying. Is that not how it goes?

Naaber_221.speaker: Player
Naaber_221.text: What god are you praying to?

Naaber_191.speaker: Player
Naaber_191.text: It's more like... By your sacrament ever be praised. Oh holy, most wise, eternal god...

Naaber_5.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_5.text: Wooooooow. That was awesome! I bet it even works when you do it.

Naaber_156.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_156.text: You're very good at this! Perhaps you can teach me. I'm trying to pray.

Naaber_149.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_149.text: But why? We're having so much fun!

Naaber_136.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_136.text: If not a rogue, then a ranger. I'm great at chasing things down.

Naaber_104.speaker: Player
Naaber_104.text: I hope you're looking forward to those long, lonely months on the trail.

Naaber_118.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_118.text: Godsdammit, why are so many adventurer jobs so lonely?! I thought you were supposed to have parties?

Naaber_4.speaker: Player
Naaber_4.text: Look! A displacer beast! Go after it!

Naaber_203.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_203.text: Wait a minute... you were pulling my leg! Haha! Good one! But you're not getting rid of old Naaber that easily.

Naaber_52.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_52.text: I am a bit too chatty, aren't I? Haha. OH WELL.

Naaber_66.speaker: Player
Naaber_66.text: You're great at nothing. In fact, you're the worst person I've ever met.

Naaber_26.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_26.text: Oh pish! I'm great at being your friend. And that's all that matters! Friendship! Yay!

Naaber_262.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_262.text: Your fists, silly! I'm trying something out.

Naaber_139.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_139.text: My name's Naaber, adventurer-to-be, soon to be the best adventurer anyone's ever seen.

Naaber_60.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_60.text: As soon as I figure out what kind of adventurer I'm going to be... What do you think? Could I be a fighter?

Naaber_137.speaker: Player
Naaber_137.text: Why don't you actually fight me and I'll tell you?

Naaber_206.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_206.text: Um - sure. I'll just... raise my fists and...

Naaber_186.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_186.text: Urgh. It's no use. I can't do it.

Naaber_100.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_100.text: Guess old Naaber's more of a talker than a fighter.

Naaber_46.speaker: Player
Naaber_46.text: Here's a tip to get you started - less talking, more fighting.

Naaber_43.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_43.text: Right you are! I'll just... find something to punch... I guess...

Naaber_190.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_190.text: It won't hurt, will it? No, surely not...

Naaber_81.speaker: Player
Naaber_81.text: Follow your dreams and find out.

Naaber_158.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_158.text: Phew. I was hoping you'd say that. To tell you the truth, I don't actually like hurting people very much. Or getting hurt.

Naaber_51.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_51.text: It's a good job I ran into you!

Naaber_215.speaker: Player
Naaber_215.text: I think you're not even worth being sacrificed to Lord Bhaal.

Naaber_238.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_238.text: Oh. All right, then! Sorry to bother you!

Naaber_218.speaker: Player
Naaber_218.text: I could not give less of a shit.

Naaber_6.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_6.text: Yay! You spoke to me! Nobody ever talks to me.

Naaber_39.speaker: Player
Naaber_39.text: It's pronounced 'grovel afore me or die'.

Naaber_130.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_130.text: Wait! I wasn't really going to fight you! I was just trying something out!

Naaber_175.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_175.text: Know any fiendish philanthropists? Fickle fae financiers? Eldritch employers? I want to make a pact.

Naaber_96.speaker: Player
Naaber_96.text: Are you sure you're ready to be a warlock? To sell your soul for eternity?

Naaber_31.speaker: Player
Naaber_31.text: My patron might still be in the market for souls. I'll put in a good word for you.

Naaber_126.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_126.text: My soul? I have to give up my soul to become a warlock?

Naaber_68.speaker: Player
Naaber_68.text: Here's a pact for you. Give up.

Naaber_254.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_254.text: That's not a pact. That's just an order... Oh-ho! Very good! You nearly had me there!

Naaber_234.speaker: Player
Naaber_234.text: No pact needed. I hope a devil finds you and takes you straight to the Hells.

Naaber_142.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_142.text: Awwww, that's so nice of you to say! Thanks! I hope so too! Bet it's really warm there.

Naaber_235.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_235.text: Please don't leave! I don't want to be alone.

Naaber_20.speaker: Player
Naaber_20.text: What in the hells are you doing now?

Naaber_65.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_65.text: I'm pretending to be a dog. Everyone likes dogs!

Naaber_63.speaker: Player
Naaber_63.text: I liked you more as a human.

Naaber_233.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_233.text: That's not true! My mum does. Wait no, she loves me, but does she actually like me...?
Naaber_233.context: NodeContext: trails off into his own thoughts

Naaber_231.speaker: Player
Naaber_231.text: An admirable pursuit. Those creatures understand the true meaning of life.

Naaber_176.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_176.text: Ah ha! You fell for it!

Naaber_249.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_249.text: Wait, come back! I was only pretending!

Naaber_247.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_247.text: BOO! Bet you didn't even see me coming. I'm a shadow, a master of sneakery. A rogue.

Naaber_25.speaker: Player
Naaber_25.text: Was someone talking? I hear them, but I can't see them!

Naaber_182.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_182.text: Oooooh I might be too good at this. What if no one ever sees me again?!

Naaber_113.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_113.text: What if no one ever talks to me again?! NOOOOOOOO!

Naaber_17.speaker: Player
Naaber_17.text: No, you're not. I see you. You're right there.

Naaber_29.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_29.text: Oh thank goodness. I was worried I was getting too good at it and nobody would ever see me again.

Naaber_72.speaker: Player
Naaber_72.text: Are you ready for the long, drawn-out silences of an assassin's pursuit?

Naaber_15.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_15.text: Why do so many professions have to be done in silence?!

Naaber_242.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_242.text: I LIKE TALKING. TALKING IS THE BEST.

Naaber_266.speaker: Player
Naaber_266.text: You are a pain in the arse, that's what you are.

Naaber_248.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_248.text: You're joking, right? Because that's what friends do?

Naaber_236.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_236.text: Ha ha ha! Very good! And you're a pain in the arm!

Naaber_243.speaker: Narrator
Naaber_243.text: *A faint, muffled squeak accompanies your departure - Naaber, trying to stop himself from giving away his position.*

Naaber_252.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_252.text: Behold, mundane meddler. You step in the domain of a master speller. For I am to be a most mighty WIZARD.

Naaber_160.speaker: Player
Naaber_160.text: I know this one. You're a wizard.

Naaber_102.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_102.text: Wizard. W - I - Z - A - R - D. Wizard.

Naaber_36.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_36.text: That wasn't it, was it? Bum.

Naaber_220.speaker: Player
Naaber_220.text: No, spell. As in magic spell. The thing wizards cast.

Naaber_22.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_22.text: Wait, there's another step after that? Rats.

Naaber_155.speaker: Player
Naaber_155.text: Show me what you can do.

Naaber_103.speaker: Player
Naaber_103.text: That's spelling. Wizards cast spells. Idiot.

Naaber_168.speaker: Player
Naaber_168.text: How wondrous. What school of magic is your specialty?

Naaber_135.speaker: Player
Naaber_135.text: I regret ever talking to you.

Naaber_258.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_258.text: Oh. Oh. That hurts, you know?

Naaber_18.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_18.text: But we can still be friends, right? Right?

Naaber_80.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_80.text: Yaaaaay! Friends! This is the best day of Naaber's life.

Naaber_12.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_12.text: Wait, wait! I promise I won't turn you into a flumph! I literally don't know how!

Naaber_261.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_261.text: These roles sure are restrictive, aren't they? Maybe the adventuring life's just not for me.

Naaber_188.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_188.text: I really like talking to you. There's not a lot of people that want to talk to me so I bought you a present. Here.

Naaber_189.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_189.text: Now what are we going to talk about if not about the adventuring life?

Naaber_19.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_19.text: Wait wait. What if I mix the classes... Oh Naaber, you GENIUS!

Naaber_251.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_251.text: Are you scared? Did you wet your pants? Did you? Did you?

Naaber_33.speaker: Player
Naaber_33.text: Let me guess, you've decided to try being a barbarian?

Naaber_58.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_58.text: That's right! You got it! Oh yay!

Naaber_204.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_204.text: So how did I do? Are you quaking in your boots with fear?

Naaber_106.speaker: Player
Naaber_106.text: My piss lies dormant, but my gorge rises.

Naaber_95.speaker: Player
Naaber_95.text: My bladder control is exemplary, I'm afraid.

Naaber_267.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_267.text: YES! Naaber has found his calling!

Naaber_201.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_201.context: NodeContext: Roar descends into feeble spluttering and coughing.

Naaber_49.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_49.text: You're very kind, but I can tell that you're humouring me. Everyone's always humouring me. *Sigh.*

Naaber_14.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_14.text: Oh wow, yours is much better.

Naaber_170.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_170.text: Oh well. Back to the Naabing board!

Naaber_237.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_237.text: Oh wow, that sounds awful. I don't think I want to sound like that.

Naaber_67.speaker: Player
Naaber_67.text: You don't know when to shut up, do you?

Naaber_7.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_7.text: So what do you say - did I scare ya?

Naaber_205.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_205.text: Wait! I didn't mean to scare you off! Come back!

Naaber_AD_0.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_AD_0.text: Hiiiiiiii. Still here. Still have things to say!

Naaber_AD_1.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_AD_1.text: Hellooooooo! Want to talk? I love to talk.

Naaber_AD_2.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_AD_2.text: You're making me feel really needy. Haha.

Naaber_AD_4.speaker: Naaber
Naaber_AD_4.text: How about now? Want to talk now?
